Reviews.Title: HQ User Friendly Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Byrd
Reviews.Content: Very User friendly camera for beginners. Purchased for $199. It is a 16mp camera with 1080p video. It has a good sensor and lens, so it produces high quality images. The lens and sensor matter more than the megapixel count. I have an old KODAK easyshare C653  6.1mp camera that takes better pictures than a Samsung PL120 14.2mp for that reason. For video, I prefer using the 720p setting so the battery lasts longer, and it is still very good quality. It has Wi-Fi, so you can transfer your videos and pictures to your pc that way, or directly to Facebook if you have an internet connection. I prefer to just put the memory card in the pc myself and copy & paste to the destination I want. The default auto settings seem to work very well, but there are other settings and features once you get more familiar with the camera.It has the usual delay mode for setting the camera down to tae group pictures with the photographer. The timer can be custom set up to a 30 second delay if you want, and up to 10 pictures can be taken before setting it again. Or you can use a feature that when it detects a smile, or wink, it will take a picture.There is less than 1 second delay after taking a picture until the still image is off the screen and you can tae another picture.The 12x optical zoom works great and can make high quality 8x10 photos. The 24x digital zoom is good too and works good with 5x7, but I haven't tried it for 8x10 yet. The 48x digital zoom is ok, but does lose some quality.Video: It can use the 12x optical zoom for video, and unlike some other cameras, with the Canon Powershot ELPH 340 HS, you CAN zoom in and out while recording video. The microphone is located in the front of the camera too, so your fingers don't cover it.

Reviews.Title: Convenient Feature Camera while on the Go
Reviews.Author: Gi Fine
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to use at times I didn't/couldn't lug around my T3i with me; also, it's replacing my SD1400is (2010). So far I am pleased with the quality and abundance of features that are packed into this camera!Pros:Nice image qualityFast focusWi-Fi/NFC capabilitiesSmooth/great quality HD filmingCons:The body is pretty light, I like/am used to heavier frames. I miss the cold aluminum sturdiness of the SD1400is.It doesn't come with a usb cord - I'm sure by now you may have an extra mini usb cord (top hat) laying around but it would've been nice.LCD can be a bit grainy at times.Canon went with the new Digic 4+ processor  for the ELPH 340 - think of it as a happy medium between Digic 4 and 5 but optimized. I haven't had any issues with speed or lag. The camera responds promptly every time. As far as battery life, I will report back after a day of shooting images. Either way I still would recommend you purchase a back up battery just in case.The initial set up was quick and painless. I would love if they added the ability to include copyright info within the camera but this can be done in Photoshop in a click - it would still be nice to have. The Wi-Fi was surprisingly responsive and I ran into no trouble with setting it up with my router, phone or PC. This camera also has NFC for even easier connections.In my test videos, I was impressed with the image stability the most - this would make a great vlogging companion. The screen has a small amount of grain during playback but remember this is for review. Once imported into my computer the HD video looked great.*IMPORTANT*You must try out the Canon CW app in tandem with the camera. This app has remote shutter, the ability to share/browse pictures, remote shut off, and more! Even if you don't plan on using it, give it a try. I used it with the Android app. Though there is a slight delay, but it isn't off putting.All in all I am happy with my purchase and plan to use this for a long time. I will upload pictures into the customer photo section as soon as I can!*Update*I have added a couple images to the customer section. I am having a great time working with this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love, love, love my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Jonno
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a Canon PowerShot a number of years ago and was looking to upgrade. I only had one minor issue with that camera's zoom, so I wanted to  stick with the Canon brand. I wasn't sure at first about buying a camera that hadn't been released yet, but I liked what I saw based on the specs. I wanted a compact point and shoot camera with more optical zoom than my original camera, as well as video and wi-fi. I was also hesitant on paying $199.99, but I was willing to pay a bit more for the features.I had read some reviews out there stating that this camera has "too much noise", but I honestly don't even notice. The pictures are beautiful and the optical zoom is great.The wi-fi was fairly easy to set up and the NFC with my smartphone is a plus, but it does drain the battery if you're using that feature alot on one charge. The camera does have eco-mode which turns off your screen after a shot to help to save your battery - a simple push of any button on the camera will turn the screen back on right away so that you can take your next picture. I purchased a back up battery just in case I need it.The camera is light weight (not as heavy duty as my original Canon point and shoot), but it seems durable. I plan on adding a screen protector to the screen to prevent scratches. I've been using this camera for about a week now and am impressed. I plan on using it on my upcoming vacation to capture shots that would otherwise be grainy / dark with my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Impressive so far
Reviews.Author: Joshua Kuntz
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera yesterday, but so far I like what I see. I am a single father and bought this camera to take on spring break with my son. It is replacing a $99 Canon point & shoot that I bought two years ago when the battery died on my phone while on vacation. This camera is better in every way. It is smaller, lighter (yet somehow more solid), 3 times the zoom, and better stats. I took a dozen or so shots messing around after getting the battery charged. I know there are much better cameras out there, but I felt like this camera performed more than acceptably for how I will use it. It turns on quickly, has very little lag between pictures, and seems to focus and adjust very well in auto mode.I do want to talk about the wireless features too. I installed the CameraWindow app on my Android phone right away. Connecting to the camera's built in hotspot was very easy. I was also able to connect through my home router without any trouble. The controls on this app are pretty basic, but it seems to have all the bases covered. I think the remote shooting mode will really come in handy on our trip. I have a small portable tripod, and between the two, I think I will be able to capture many more memories than the last family vacation. Also, there is something cool about the "long distance selfie" :) I probably will not go through to trouble of signing up for Canon's online service because it doesn't seem that useful to me. I feel I can already do all the things it does once the pictures are on my phone or computer.There are only two drawbacks I can see to this camera so far. First, this is right at the top of what I would spend on point & shoot camera. I don't have any buyer's remorse, but I definitely thought long and hard about spending that much money for a camera. I also realize I didn't do myself any favors in that department by buying the camera on day one of it's release, but the timing was perfect. Last, I wish that this camera had a touch screen and a better menu system. I realize that it is so small a touch screen might be more trouble than it is worth, but the menus and buttons are the same on this camera as they have been on Canon cameras for probably 15 years. I guess a little "if it's not broke, don't fix it" may apply, but it give the camera a less than premium feel at a premium price point.UPDATE: I took this camera on spring break with me and I am very happy with how it worked. The wireless feature is very useful, but there is room for improvement. First, there is no multi-select in the Camera Window app. I was moving pics to my phone, and it would have been nice to check them off and move them all together instead of moving them one by one. I supppose this is a way to try and force you into the Canon Web service, but I have decided not to go down that road. My phone already does all of the stuff that service does, so I see no need for it. Second, the remote shooting is a very nice feature, but it takes a long time to get it setup. Even with NFC, you still have to connect your phone to the camera via WiFi. I guess if you carried a hot spot around, maybe you could leave both devices to that, but that seems a bit convoluted and probably wouldn't improve the experience much. If you decide to use remoting shooting, be prepared to spend a lot of time switching between it and normal mode. Once you are connected, it is very nice to be able to see the picture you are going to take while standing in the frame before you snap the shutter.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Duke
Reviews.Content: I was very familiar with Canon point-and-shoot cameras, and when I dropped my previous model and it stopped working, there was no question that I would buy Canon again. I went to [...]  and did a little research first; I suggest you do the same. This camera fit all my specifications. I use this camera mostly to shoot society events, so most of my photography is people in black tuxedos standing in dimly lit rooms; I needed a breast-pocket size camera that could perform in low-light situations. This camera really shines in those situations. It has all the bells and whistles you will ever need, has a nice display screen, the functions are intuitive, the size is perfect (always use the lanyard around your wrist; I learned the hard way) and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: AuntieBroom
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to lug my bigger point and shoot Canon, I bought this camera to take on vacation.  Very user-friendly... my zip-line tour guide grabbed it and took some amazing photos and videos!  I love that it's small enough to toss in my purse or pocket...  I end up taking (and using) it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Photostitch? Color?
Reviews.Author: Stevie C. Rox "Stevie C. Rox"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera because it has WIFI where my Elph 110HS did not. I don't know if it's me but I can't seem to find Photostitch on the new 340HS. I love this feature and it would be a shame to not have it. I guess I'm keeping both cameras then.P.S.I've been using this camera only to find that the color is way off. I went to a wedding this past weekend where the shirt and tie I was wearing was purple. Every picture I was in it came out blue. WTF!!! I'm going back to my Elph 110 HS. WiFi was just a gimmick. Waste of 2 bills.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Aethelbert
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera just before leaving for trip. Size makes it great for slipping in the pocket and it takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Hudson
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a fairly good point and shoot camera that I bought as an small alternative to my cumbersome DSLR.Image quality is pretty good.Good zoom range.Fast focusing.The camera is pretty compact. About the size of my wallet. When off the lens retracts, it is flush with the body.No issues so far.As a heads up to anyone purchasing it, this camera does not include a SD memory card.

Reviews.Title: it's a great camera!
Reviews.Author: Amy Kronish
Reviews.Content: we love the quality of the pictures.  we love the compactness.  we love the zoom. we love the ease with which you can click and shoot photos or video.

Reviews.Title: If you want WiFi don't buy this
Reviews.Author: Sue Rockwell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos and probably video too, but if you want to upload by WiFi you won't like this camera.  Images must go through Canon iMage Gateway which is a nightmare to log in to.  Too bad, I thought it would everything I was looking for in a camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera...not so great wi-fi feature
Reviews.Author: Tierra W.
Reviews.Content: Photos and zoom are Great!!!  Menu is easy to navigate once used a few times.  Took me almost an hour to get the Wi-Fi linked to my smartphone.  Have tried multiple times today to link to my laptop with NO luck.  Manual isn't much help for the issue.  Online registration is a pain.  If not for Wi-Fi issue, I would give the camera an A+.  The purple color shown is not accurate.  It has more of a pinkish-purple look, but still nice.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Feline Lover "feline lover"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and I am already getting a lot of use out of it.  It does take great pictures and is small enough to fit in my pocket.  Most of the time it takes great shots in low light, although some of our pictures came out too dark.  Don't know if that was my fault or not.  Since, this is suppose to be a point and shoot camera.  I already have the ELPH 330 HS which takes great pictures in the light or dark.  So I will still have some testing to do with this newer camera.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly fine!
Reviews.Author: Pablo Rivera "Pablo Rivera"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it takes awesome photos and even better videos with 1080p Full HD. Best quality photos for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: One of the best
Reviews.Author: LA
Reviews.Content: I've owed Canon products for years and this has to be one of the best. Light weight, compact and chrystal clear pictures are just a few of the rewards you will have when you purchase this gem. Canon, as usual GREAT JOB ! Oh and by the way you don't have to be a rocket scientist to operate it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Shop-a-holic
Reviews.Content: It is the size of my phone and takes great pics. Easy to use. No problems at all. Fit my needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Cannon seems to get better and better!!
Reviews.Author: Ted Orr
Reviews.Content: This replaces an earlier Cannon camera.  The nicest part is that it does not take batteris and is rechargeable!Connon continues to make taking great photos a snap!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Heike Elder
Reviews.Content: Still learning things about it, but love the size and the pretty much unpack and use-ability!  Lots of settings I have yet to use, but the size is perfect, throw it in my purse or in its own case which is great too!  I've been wanting an aleph camera for a long time, glad I waited for this one.

Reviews.Title: wi-fi challenging
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 hours trying to connect my new camera to my wifi.  I was able to connect it to Google Drive but not to my computer or smartphone, all on the same wireless network.  I have a linksys router and followed all the steps many times but could not get it to work.Update:tried again for 2 hours the next day and finally got wifi to work.  Don't bother with the ImageGateway or link to computer, just use the ImageSync set-up, which downloads pics directly to your computer.  Like people have said, the purple is not quite right in the pic--it's a little more fuchsia but I still like it.  I will try to upload an image.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ShaeJay
Reviews.Content: Battery life is good so far. Pictures are of a great quality. I'm no professional photographer so I cannot go in depth.  It does the job! By the way, the zoom is pretty awesome!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Sen
Reviews.Content: This is my second canon powershot. Much better, improved and very nice camera. Enjoying it to the fullest. Instructions for wifi connectivity needs improvement.

Reviews.Title: Good low light
Reviews.Author: C&D
Reviews.Content: Very good in low light. Long battery life only changed once and used for a week (about 200 photos). Like the internet hook up. Carful with canon web site when you set up, they will send you emails all the time,

Reviews.Title: Linking up to a computer or smartphone is a nightmare
Reviews.Author: ADMD
Reviews.Content: It is small, works reasonably well as a point and shoot.  But I bought the new one because of the ability to do wireless links.  Whoever coded the software made things very complicated.  I am frustrated and disappointed.  They need to hire some user interface people.  I use an iPhone and a Mac.  Lastly, it is plasticky, I would buy the warrant if I were you.

Reviews.Title: Read this before purchasing...
Reviews.Author: blane p berry
Reviews.Content: It's cute and small, which makes it handy.  What surprised me was that it would not communicate with the tablet I own.  Maybe it's my fault for not looking under every rock & in every crack to discover exactly what tablets will communicate with this camera, but I thought any would and now I don't have use of that function.  That was the main reason that I bought this camera- to control it remotely.  Oh well, let my loss be your gain.  Be sure you own a tablet that will communicate with this camera.  Also, when I found a friend who had a tablet that would talk to my camera, it would not (it does not) communicate for movies, only pictures.  I had no idea.  I felt a little taken, because this kind of thing should be easier to learn about before you buy.  I shouldn't have to dig and study to learn the details just so I don't make a wrong purchase.  The write-up should just be up front about the particulars.  Also, to use the camera down-load feature on line, you must start an account, yes, another account, another password.  That might not be such a big deal in this day and age, so I tried.  But the account would not recognize me.  It said I input wrong info as I signed in.  I actually thought I did, so I said to send me a temp password so I could get in and fix things, but the temp password wouldn't work either.  I tried almost 20 times.  So much for that feature.  Something wasn't right in the app/program.  Very frustrating.  It did download to my computer through my wifi, but it takes a lot longer than pulling the SD card and letting it fly through direct.  So, I feel let down and kind of cheated.

Reviews.Title: No Help
Reviews.Author: TERRY R. MARTIN
Reviews.Content: I think they should have included an instruction manual with camera, it's very hard to understand with no help from canon

Reviews.Title: lost my Elph 310 - bought the 340 to replace
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Dobrzensky
Reviews.Content: Replaces our elph 310 which was lost.  I hope this is as good.  So far so good!  Canon is great

Reviews.Title: why did you choose this rating?
Reviews.Author: young jae lee
Reviews.Content: it is so good camera with so many different features and with wi-fi mode.I love it .I would recommend to anyone to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Very noisy images
Reviews.Author: Andrey Okhlopkov
Reviews.Content: Incredibly bad cameraImages are very noisy, even in pretty good conditions.iPhone 5 makes better images with less noise.Will return

Reviews.Title: No wire and No Wireless
Reviews.Author: The Kwil
Reviews.Content: The camera does not come with a USB wire that allows you to import images into your PC with the ImageBrowser. The wireless connection does not work either. My tablet can see the camera (after registering with CGI) and the camera finds the tablet on the wireless network, so that much is working, but any attempt to download the images always fails with an error message like "Cannot detect camera. Check connection to camera, then retry." That happens for both ImageBrowserEX and directly using CameraWindow. This would probably be acceptable if it shipped with the USB cable, but it does not! So for all practical purposes there is no "out of the box" way to get your photos from the camera onto a PC. If your PC is connected to the network, which includes a wireless router, using a wire, then the camera never finds it on the network even though I ran the wireless enabler program on the PC. Tus, if you have an older PC that does not have wireless or like me, a new PC but do not want to run your 1 Gbps PC/network on a slow 54 Mbps wireless network, then you are hosed

Reviews.Title: Nice!!!
Reviews.Author: Tracey Brewer
Reviews.Content: Haven't gotten to really use it will update more later. My son has one and enjoys it he is 11. It's easy for him to use and takes great pics

Reviews.Title: Warning- Color is not accurate
Reviews.Author: STACY
Reviews.Content: Color is fuschia not purple.  It is a nice color but nowhere close to the picture. I will be using it in the next few days and hope it does not disappoint.

ProductInfo.Features:
12x Optical Zoom helps ensure outstanding optical performance and versatility.
Built-in Wi-Fi allows wireless transferring of images and video to compatible mobile devices, select social networking sites and your Wi-Fi enabled computer, and lets you remotely shoot using your smartphone or tablet.
16.0 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor with the DIGIC 4+ Image Processor creates the Canon HS SYSTEM, which helps provide excellent low-light performance.
Creative Shot mode uses composition, color and lighting from your original image to create unique images with an artistic flair.
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper camera settings based on 32 predefined shooting situations.
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 340 HS 16MP Digital Camera (Purple)
